channel.title: Coin on Fourthpp Collections
channel.description: Recent content in Coin on Fourthpp Collections

item.title: Hare Coins
item.description: Burmese hare coins are made of lead and have two denominations, ¼ copper and ⅛ copper. Since copper coin is ¼ Pe, the face value of Hare coin is ¼ x ¼ , which is 1/16 Pe, and ⅛ x ¼, which is 1/32 Pe. The years are 1230 and 1231 Burmese calendar. But how many of them are there? Which one is rarer? I checked the database myself, and I recorded about 60 hare coins, of which 47 can be guessed their year, only 3 are in 1230, and the others are all 1231.

item.title: Small Peacock Silver Coin Varieties
item.description: Pe small peacock silver coins are listed into 5 varieties on the SCWC catalogue, which are Km6.1-6.5. In the book of “The Coins and Banknotes of Burma”, the combinations of front and back side of it can get 6 varieties. The differences between the varieties are mainly due to the missage and alterations of the figures in date (blue rectangle) and the denomination (red oval). SCWC Corresponds to “The Coins and Banknotes of Burma” Km6.
